synopsis.text:
Bronze Age meets modern technology in "The Master of Ragnarok & Blesser of Einherjar," where Yuuto Suoh, a curious teenager, stumbles upon an ancient urban legend surrounding a divine mirror at his local shrine. Upon taking a photo with the mirror, he is catapulted into a mystical world reminiscent of Central European Bronze Age and steeped in Norse mythology.

Armed with only his solar-powered smartphone and school-taught knowledge, Yuuto adapts to this new environment, learning the language and customs. He finds himself becoming the leader of the Wolf Clan, a group that has taken him in as one of their own. In this parallel world, Yuuto must navigate the complexities of clan warfare and use his modern know-how to elevate the Wolf Clan's standing.

As he gains the admiration of the Einherjar, a group of enchanting, magic-wielding warrior maidens, Yuuto strives to unravel the secrets behind the divine mirror and find a way back to his own world, where his childhood friend eagerly awaits his return. Join Yuuto on his thrilling journey as he transforms from an ordinary boy into a powerful patriarch in this captivating battle fantasy.
